pullrequest.title: review after pull request #46 is done - add sr_hand model

content.raw:
Yep, we decided the Shadow Hand would be a good alternative for anyone who wanted to use handsim that didn't have access to the MPL arm for whatever reason. Early on, we also didn't know who we could give access to the private repo to. It turns out that APL is open sourcing the exterior shell of the model, so this is less of an issue now, but I still think it's useful to show that handsim is easily generalizable to other arms, and it's something users can play with before the open MPL model comes out.

However, I do think it's impractical to dump the Shadow Hand description into this repo, since the target audience (team performers) won't use it. Can we keep it in a different model and include a world that includes the Shadow Hand?
